issue.title: Let users change their view in the world in more diverse ways

content.raw:
One suggestion I have from using the follow mode on various 3D mobile models, is to be able to specify a specific [fixed] offset pose or offset direction to follow the model from ([maybe require some changes here?](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/603/camera-follow/diff#Lgazebo/rendering/Camera.ccT405)). 

Using the current follow behavior the camera ends up pointing towards the model from wherever they approach the model from.

So for example, if I am following an ascending flying model, the camera is constantly catching up to the model from below, and looking at the sky. From my experience with examples like this one, it is almost always more useful to look at the model (as the model ascends) from angles other than below (e.g. view model horizontally or vertically downward).
